definitions.example: If you go into the aviary, don't let out any of the birds!

definitions.definition: Of a school: to finish for the day or term, allowing the pupils to go home.
To allow to operate at higher speed by adjusting controls.
definitions.example: He let out the reins when they were a mile from the barn.

definitions.definition: (of clothing) To enlarge by adjusting one or more seams.
definitions.example: After the holidays he had to have his suits let out.
The dog let out a yelp.
He accidentally let out the location for the meeting.
